content.description: The US struck three major nuclear sites Sunday, aiming to stop Iran’s nuclear plans. Deemed “Operation Midnight Hammer”
The Midwest and East U.S. faced another day of extreme heat Sunday as a rare June heat wave persisted.

The president has attacked Powell for months for not cutting interest rates faster, despite appointing him, claims he might try to fire him. Federal law says Fed board members, including the chair, can only be fired for cause.

outlook: Rising geopolitical tension, extreme weather, and political pressure on the Fed add risk to economic stability. Markets may turn cautious as uncertainty grows.
